Key Arguments: The proposed legislation conflicts with Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which guarantees freedom of opinion and expression.
The bill is seen as a threat to democracy and freedom of speech, as it could lead to political censorship.
The ACMA is not truly independent as it operates under the direction of the parliament.
The legislation could legitimize the suppression of free speech on social media platforms.
The government has previously spread misinformation, particularly regarding vaccine mandates, which undermines its credibility in regulating misinformation.
Notable Quotes: This proposed Bill is in direct conflict with the 'Universal Declaration of Human Rights' Article 19.
The only threat to the safety and wellbeing of Australians will be through the abuse of unconstitutional powers.
This proposed bill will legitimize the suppression of free speech.
Political censorship spells the end of democracy.
